p: Nerol (30 to 300 mg/kg) prevented or decreased the pathological changes observed in the colitis model. It also showed antinociceptive effects and reduced the increased levels of inflammatory cytokines (IL-13 and TNF-α) [ 91]. Among the inflammatory cytokines, TNF-α secreted by several populations of immune and stromal cells is considered responsible for amplifying and maintaining chronic inflammation in IBDs [ 3]; its inhibition has been used as a therapeutic strategy in IBDs [ 15].
